Apply Rotation Update

Source: R/rotation.R
rotation.Rd

Implements the Han–Kim lookup-table rule to rotate qubit amplitudes towards the bit values of high-fitness solutions, based on the current generation's best individual and the global best.

rotation(
  chromosome,
  best_chromosome,
  generation,
  genomeLength,
  solution_best,
  q_alphabeta,
  work_q_alphabeta,
  popsize,
  fitness,
  theta
)

Arguments

chromosome

Integer matrix `[popsize, genomeLength]` of 0/1 bits.

best_chromosome

Integer vector; index of best individual per generation.

generation

Integer. Current generation index (1-based).

genomeLength

Integer. Total number of bits per chromosome.

solution_best

Integer vector of length `genomeLength` representing the global best bitstring.

q_alphabeta

Numeric array `[genomeLength, 2, popsize]` with amplitudes.

work_q_alphabeta

Numeric workspace array like `q_alphabeta`.

popsize

Integer. Population size.

fitness

Numeric vector of length `popsize` with fitness values.

theta

Numeric (radians). Rotation step size.

Value

Updated `q_alphabeta` amplitude array.

Contents
